illustration.illusobjdesc: Four composition sketches are each separated by rough framing lines. The sketch in the upper left quadrant contains at least one figure with raised arms leaning right, away from what may be flames at left. The sketch in the upper right quadrant shows at least one figure seated facing right. The sketch in the lower left quadrant contains two figures seated on a couch with an elaborate bolster-like arm. Clouds or perhaps beams of light are visible above the pair at left. The sketch in the lower right quadrant contains a single gowned figure facing right with one arm raised horizontally. There is a cluster of diagonal brushstrokes of grey wash to the left of this figure. To the left of the line demarcating the lower left scene, a portion of a sketch continued from another leaf of sketches (Butlin 85 verso) is visible, indicating that the two pages were originally part of the same sheet of paper.

component.illusobjdesc: Four composition sketches are each separated by rough framing lines. The sketch in the upper left quadrant contains at least one figure who stands, runs, or perhaps leans to the right. Its right leg is extended backward, its right arm raised horizontally, and its left arm raised at 135 degrees. The figure may twist its head to look back to the left, where lines that suggest flames extend from the left margin of the sketch from which the figure is fleeing. The multiplicity of lines forming the figure may suggest movement or, alternatively, the presence of a second figure directly behind the first. This second figure, partly erased, may be an alternative posture for the first figure.
Lines that suggest flames extend from the left margin of the sketch in the upper left quadrant. The line below the figure may be the ground, or possibly a body of water with a single wave.

Four composition sketches are each separated by rough framing lines. The sketch in the upper right quadrant shows at least one figure seated or kneeling on bent legs facing right with one arm raised at 45 degrees. This figure appears to wear a gown with a belt. There may be a second head and extended arm suggested behind and to the right of the first figure. This second figure, perhaps partly erased, may be an alternative posture for the first figure. Lines on the right side of the sketch suggest fire and smoke. The figure may be warming its hands at the fire.
Lines on the right side of the sketch in the upper right quadrant suggest file and smoke.

Four composition sketches are each separated by rough framing lines. The sketch in the lower left quadrant contains two forward-facing figures seated on a couch with an elaborate bolster-like arm at right. The figure at left appears to be gowned with its right arm raised at 45 degrees. The figure holds an indistinct object that may be a book or tablet(?), suggesting he or she may be reading.

Four composition sketches are each separated by rough framing lines. The sketch in the lower left quadrant contains two forward-facing figures seated on a couch with an elaborate bolster-like arm at right. The figure at right has long hair and a beard, suggesting he is male. In his lap, he holds what appears to be an open book in which he writes or draws with his right hand. He wears a long gown and his legs may be crossed at the ankle.
The sketch in the lower left quadrant contains two forward-facing figures seated on a couch with an elaborate bolster-like arm at right.

The sketch in the lower left quadrant contains two figures seated on a couch. The figure at right holds in his lap what appears to be an open book in which he writes or draws. His companion may also hold a book or tablet in its right hand.
Above and to the left the pair of seated figures in the sketch lower left is a cluster of lines suggesting clouds and perhaps diagonal beams of light.

To the left of the line demarcating the lower left scene, a portion of a sketch continued from another leaf of sketches (Butlin 85 verso) is visible, indicating that the two pages were originally part of the same sheet of paper. A figure's left shoulder, arm, and hand braced on the ground extend into this object.

Four composition sketches are each separated by rough framing lines. The sketch in the lower right quadrant contains a single gowned figure facing right with one arm raised horizontally and slightly bent. One of his fingers or perhaps his thumb may be raised, pointing upward. The figure appears to have long, curly(?) hair and a beard, suggesting he is male.

There is a cluster of diagonal brushstrokes of grey wash to the left of the figure in the lower right quadrant. These may suggest a shadow. The pen strokes upper left do not clearly represent anything and may only be part of the adjacent framing line.
